content: We will begin todayâs call with Lori Woods, Isorayâs Chief Executive Officer; and Thijs Spoor, Chief Executive Officer of Viewpoint Molecular Targeting; and then Jonathan Hunt, Isoray's Chief Financial Officer will discuss the fiscal first quarter 2023 financial results. Total other brachytherapy revenue only declined 7% versus the first quarter of fiscal '22 as sales to treat brain cancers, which includes sales to GT Medical Technologies increased 15% year-over-year despite the supply disruption. First quarter gross profit dollars of $414,000 decreased 60% when compared to the same period last year, total operating expenses, consisting of research and development, sales and marketing and general and administrative increased to $4.6 million versus $3.3 million in the first quarter of 2022.
